variant.subsectionHeader: Linking Biological Literature, Ontologies and Databases, pg. 49. Association for Computational Linguistics. Text Mining - Next Steps for Drug Discovery
variant.bodyText: William S Hayes, PhD, Discovery IS/IX, AstraZeneca R&D 35 Gatehouse Dr, Waltham, MA, 02451 USA William.S.Hayes@astrazeneca.com The text mining community has shown significant impact for use of text mining in drug discovery and basic research. So far, there have been a lot of point solutions that have solved a particular problem or augmented a valuable database. The next step is integrating text mining as part of the entire literature analytic solution and delivering it effectively and comprehensively to support research in academia, biotechs and pharmaceuticals.

variant.note: HLT-NAACL 2004 Workshop: Biolink 2004, Linking Biological Literature, Ontologies and Databases, pg. 49. Association for Computational Linguistics.
variant.title: Text Mining - Next Steps for Drug Discovery
variant.author: William S Hayes
Discovery ISIX
AstraZeneca R&D
variant.abstract: The text mining community has shown significant impact for use of text mining in drug discovery and basic research. So far, there have been a lot of point solutions that have solved a particular problem or augmented a valuable database. The next step is integrating text mining as part of the entire literature analytic solution and delivering it effectively and comprehensively to support research in academia, biotechs and pharmaceuticals.
